doc_title: Enhancing Environmental Health and Safety_ Fine-Tuning Large Lang

claims.summary: Fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) on domain-specific datasets is essential for generating relevant responses in the Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) domain.
claims.evidence_span: if we want it to respond to queries and questionnaires specific to a domain in our case the EHS domain we need to fine-tune it based on a domain-specific dataset.

claims.summary: Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT) allows for adapting pre-trained models to specific tasks without the need for extensive retraining, making it suitable for EHS applications.
claims.evidence_span: Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT) is a method used to adapt an existing pre-trained, for a particular domain or task.

claims.summary: The study aims to develop specialized LLMs tailored for EHS applications to address the unique complexities and regulatory requirements of the field.
claims.evidence_span: Therefore, the main motivation of our research is to bridge this gap by developing specialized LLMs tailored specifically for EHS applications.

claims.summary: The research includes constructing a custom dataset for EHS by collecting data from regulatory websites and EHS professionals to enhance model training.
claims.evidence_span: Construct a custom dataset for Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS) by scraping regulatory websites, manually collecting data from various EHS books and anonymous answers from EHS professionals in the industry.

claims.summary: The study will test fine-tuned models on real-world EHS scenarios to demonstrate their practical applicability in the field.
claims.evidence_span: Test the fine-tuned models on various real-world EHS scenarios to demonstrate the ability to employ fine-tuned LLMs in the EHS domain.

claims.summary: The research highlights the need for specialized LLMs that can accurately understand and respond to complex EHS terminologies and compliance requirements.
claims.evidence_span: Such a model is also important as EHS requires a very high level of accuracy and reliability.
